metadata.scale: 0-100 (where 70+ = product-market fit, 50-69 = early validation needed, <50 = pivot required)

overall_score.rationale: Strong technical execution but unclear product-market fit. Core value proposition is valid (AI recipe generation from pantry), but platform has expanded into unvalidated features (community, marketplace, B2B) before proving core. No user metrics visible, suggesting pre-launch or very early stage.

dimension_scores.rationale: Meal planning decision fatigue is a real, daily problem for millions. Wasted ingredients and dietary restrictions add complexity. Problem is urgent and painful.
improvement_opportunities: Quantify pain: survey users on time wasted
Calculate food waste cost ($X billion annually)

dimension_scores.rationale: Core solution (AI recipe generation from pantry) directly addresses problem. However, many built features (community, marketplace) don't clearly solve validated user pain.
evidence: Recipe generation API exists and works
improvement_opportunities: User testing: do generated recipes actually solve problem?
A/B test: core feature vs. full platform
Validate each feature with users before building

dimension_scores.rationale: Market exists (proven by competitors), but demand for THIS solution is unproven. No user metrics, no testimonials, no growth data visible.
evidence: Competitors (Yummly, AllRecipes) have millions of users
No user count metrics found in codebase/docs

dimension_scores.rationale: Pantry-first AI approach is differentiated, but competitors (Yummly) also have AI and grocery integration. No clear unique selling proposition yet.
evidence: Yummly has AI (Genius feature) and grocery integration
AllRecipes has massive recipe database + community
Mealime has meal planning + grocery partnerships
improvement_opportunities: Identify ONE killer feature competitors don't have
Test unique value prop with user interviews

dimension_scores.rationale: Modern tech stack suggests good UX foundation. Universal app (web + mobile) is advantage. However, feature bloat may confuse users.
improvement_opportunities: User testing on core flow (recipe generation)
Simplify UI to core features only

dimension_scores.rationale: Multiple revenue models planned (subscriptions, affiliate, marketplace, API) but none proven. No paying customers, no revenue data.
evidence: No revenue metrics, no paying customers
improvement_opportunities: Pick ONE revenue model and prove it

dimension_scores.rationale: No clear GTM strategy visible. Content marketing infrastructure exists but no execution. No partnerships secured. No growth channels validated.
Excellent technical execution: modern stack, universal app, comprehensive automation, enterprise infrastructure. Over-engineered for stage, but execution is solid.
Codebase quality suggests strong technical team. However, building without validation indicates product strategy gap. Need user research, growth, and product skills.
evidence: No user research, growth, or product validation visible

dimension_scores.rationale: Technical scalability is built (multi-tenant, cloud-native). However, business moat is unclear. AI personalization could create moat, but not yet proven at scale.
evidence: AI personalization planned but not validated
improvement_opportunities: Prove AI personalization improves over time

strengths.details: Modern stack, universal app, comprehensive automation. Enterprise-grade infrastructure built correctly.
AI recipe generation from pantry is a clear, valid solution to a real problem.
$2B+ market with growing demand. Multiple competitors validate market.

weaknesses.details: No evidence of user demand for current feature set. Many features built without validation.
Multiple revenue models planned but none proven. No paying customers, no revenue data.
Unclear unique selling proposition vs. established competitors (Yummly, AllRecipes, Mealime).
No clear growth strategy. No partnerships, no content marketing execution, no user acquisition validated.

critical_gaps.action: Get 100 real users, measure retention, engagement, referral rate
Simplify to core features, validate each before building more
Pick ONE revenue model (subscription recommended), get first paying customer
Identify ONE killer feature competitors don't have, test with users
Launch content marketing, pursue grocery partnerships, validate growth channels

actions: Get 100 real users using core feature
Simplify UI to core features only

high_risks.risk: No product-market fit achieved in 6 months
high_risks.mitigation: Focus on validation, pivot if retention <30% after 90 days
Simplify infrastructure, prove revenue before scaling
Build data moat (AI personalization), vertical specialization

medium_risks.mitigation: Simplify to core, validate before building

immediate: Freeze feature development—focus on user validation only
Simplify to core app (web + mobile), disable community/marketplace
Pick ONE revenue model (subscription), prove it
short_term: Get 1,000 active users with 40% weekly retention
Identify and test ONE killer differentiation feature
long_term: Build data moat through AI personalization
